name: Ramón Evaristo
description:
'''Ramón Martínez Fernández''' (14 October 1909 – 10 February 1990), better known as '''Ramón Evaristo''', was a Spanish bandleader and violinist based in [[Barcelona]]. In the 1940s and 1950s, his orchestra was one of the most popular ballroom music ensembles in [[Catalonia]], playing [[jazz]], [[pasodoble]]s and Latin American music such as [[rhumba]] and [[tango]].

As a composer, Evaristo wrote several popular songs, particularly [[fox-trot]]s.
